page.title: 03LIFE STYLES IN SHELFORD
page.content: for keeping all the hay and other things dry for the winter.We think that this is the most common life style in Shelford. A lot of old folk around eighty,or sixty five come to the small village of Shelford after retirement expecting a peaceful way of life as there are no industrial factories or big car parks or flats,not like the city.Old folks enjoy the summer evenings, walking around the beautiful countryside or lounging about the garden or even improving the garden. The old people also enjoy the small village for it is rarely vandalised. For example, we saw hardly any litter at all. There is only one shop in the village,the post office.Most food is bought in Radcliffe. By Ben Kirby and Warren Williamson
